meanings.definition: A person or thing that lessens the seriousness or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: The extenuator in the story was a magical amulet that reduced the power of evil spells.
meanings.sent2: The extenuator, a kind word from a friend, helped ease her worries.
meanings.sent3: The extenuator, a fluffy puppy, made everyone forget their troubles with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an extenuator, softening the harshness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The extenuator, a ray of sunshine on a rainy day, brightened everyone's mood.

meanings.definition: To make (guilt or an offense) seem less serious or more forgivable.
meanings.sent1: She tried to extenuate her mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: He hoped his good deeds would extenuate the wrongs he had done.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to extenuate the situation with a joke only made things more awkward.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of vibrant colors seemed to extenuate the beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Her heartfelt confession served to extenuate the hurt she had caused.
